intro: I'm a computer science graduate student at University of Colorado - Boulder with a focus on applied machine learning and data-driven problem solving. My background spans research in game theory, language model fairness, and scalable data pipelines — all grounded in real-world impact. I’ve worked with cross-functional teams on everything from probabilistic modeling to full-stack development, and I’m always looking for ways to bridge the gap between technology and meaningful outcomes. I’m currently looking for opportunities in data science and software engineering.

academicBackground.title: MS in Computer Science
academicBackground.note: Courses: Machine Learning, Deep Learning & Neural Networks, Data Mining, Computer Vision, Datacenter Scale Computing, AI for Science, Probability for CS

personalTouch: Outside of work, I enjoy photographing nature and playing video games. I’m also really into music — if I hadn’t gone into tech, I’d probably be a guitarist.
